intro: Lophozonia obliqua subsp. valdiviana, commonly known as the Valdivian lophozonia, is a species of flowering plant native to the temperate rainforests of southern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color, which bloom during the spring and early summer. It is adapted to the moist, cool climate of its native habitat and plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
